answers.answer: Its I'm the normal range. If your next ob apt is soon, I would ask if it anything to worry about given your symptoms as well.
Yeah, I was just wondering if my previous low blood pressure meant that the "normal" for most people meant bad news for me .. thank you though! I will discuss it with my doctor on Monday :)

If you have a jump of 30 or more in the top it bottom number you need to notify your dr right away.  They may brush it off since you are still in normal range but a 30 point jump is *not* normal.  If you are past 20 weeks plus those symptoms you need to be seen soon.  If you have any sudden swelling anywhere in your body or upper abdominal pain you need to go in ASAP.

Thank you! I'm 35 weeks on Monday and everyone seems to be taking it pretty lightly but I had a feeling I was right. . I don't have any swelling and I feel alright right now so I'm going to wait it out but if I start feeling like that again I'm definitely going into l&d.

You know your body better than anyone.  Trust your instincts.  If you feel like something is wrong, then it probably is.  You may just be creeping up there since that does sometimes happen near the end.  It's the sudden changes that are usually an emergency type of situation.  My thoughts are that you *may* have the beginning of preeclampsia but maybe not.  Technically, they would judge based on your previous BP reading--not your pre pregnancy.  So you still aren't at 30 points, but there is an increase plus some symptoms.  I think you are doing exactly what I would do...  Wait and watch and go in if anything funny happens or you just feel unwell.  Good news is you are 35 weeks!  That means the baby has excellent chances if he/she needs to come early.
Mine is also always low and at my last appt it was 120/70 and the doctor commented that it was high.  She said she was going to watch me and see if ut changes when I go back. Good Luck!

I agree with the ladies above.  I'd just like to add that it's expected for your resting hr and bp to be a bit higher than what's normal for you because you have 30% more blood circulating through your body in pregnancy.  But as stated above,  if you feel like something is wrong,  see your dr. Good luck with the rest of your pregnancy; you're almost there!  =)

question: So my blood pressure before I got pregnant was always 90/60.. since I've been pregnant it has stayed at a steady 116/66 almost every time I go into the doctor.  The past few days I have had headaches, felt like my blood was pumping ten times harder, and recently had blurry/twinkly vision. Went to a local store to check my blood pressure on a machine and it's 124/77. So my concerns are since I'm normally low is this considered high blood pressure for me? I talked to the doctor on call and she said my blood pressure is normal but I could come get checked just in case. .. but I don't understand how it's normal since its usually low and I have all these symptoms... I hope this makes sense. I'm just so confused on what to do. Anyone else have this problem?
title: Very confused...
